other_tests.findings: Multiple (at least eight) small hyperintense lesions scattered throughout both cerebral hemispheres; largest lesion 7 mm in diameter located in left centrum semiovale, indicating infarcts that occurred at least 6 hours earlier.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Repeat MRI revealed multiple foci of restricted diffusion, including a few new lesions in bilateral frontal and right occipital lobes, consistent with multiple small acute infarcts.

other_tests.findings: Hyperkinetic left ventricle without wall-motion abnormalities; obliteration of the left ventricular cavity during systole; presence of endocardial material
other_tests.changes_over_time: Echocardiographic abnormalities resolved almost completely within 6 weeks after discharge.
